it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.serviceCenters

Class ServiceCenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simcomp.basic.entities.BasicComponentLevelEntity<User,Events>
      • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.general.JEQNElement
        • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.serviceCenters.ServiceCenter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.ComponentLevelEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.GeneralEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.interfaces.Layer2ToLayer3
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InfiniteServer, NonPreemptiveServiceCenter, PreEmptiveServiceCenter

    public abstract class ServiceCenter
extends JEQNElement
    Defines the common interface, method, and the general behavior of Service Centers.
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceCenter

        public ServiceCenter(JEQNName name,
             JEQNTimeFactory timeFactory,
             it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.factories.Layer3ToLayer2Factory factory,
             it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.Time sendingAheadDelay,
             it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.Time requestUserDelay)
              throws it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException
        Creates a new ServiceCenter with the specified delays
        Parameters:
        name - Element name. The name is used to identify entities within the simulation model.
        timeFactory - Instances the jEQN time object that contains the value for the simulation time.
        factory - According to the Factory pattern, factory is used to instantiates the implementation of Layer3ToLayer2 interface, which provides level 3 services to level 2.
        sendingAheadDelay - Time object that contains the delay introduced when sending a processed users to the next entity.
        requestUserDelay - Time object that contains the delay introduced when sending a partially processed user back to the previous entity.
        Throws:
        it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException - An InvalidNameException is raised when an issue concerning the element name occurs.
